title: Domain Specific Legal Language
synopsis: [[Liquid Law]] is a [[Domain Specific Legal Language]], that enables the easy and flexible creation of the [[Terms of Reference]] of a legally defined entity to participate in the political process.

title: How to Vote for Gandhi?
synopsis: The original thought experiment that lead to the development of [[Liquid Law]] was the question: [[How to Vote for Ghandi?]]

title: How to Vote for Ghandi?
synopsis: Typo - [[How to Vote for Gandhi?]]

title: Liquid Graph Theory
synopsis: Both [[Federated Wiki]]'s and [[Liquid Democracy]] share the same need: to be able to visualise the network of connections.

title: Liquid Law
synopsis: [[Liquid Law]] is a [[Domain Specific Legal Language]], that enables the easy and flexible creation of the [[Terms of Reference]] of a legally defined entity to participate in the political process.

title: Motivation for Liquid Law
synopsis: There are a number of reasons that motivated the early work on [[Liquid Law]]. The main aim however was to humanise [[liquid democracy]].

title: Risk of Autonomous Entities
synopsis: Ward pointed me at a recent article regarding [[algorithmic entities]]. It's the first academic paper i've read on the subject specifically. It's important in terms of raising the issue of the relationship between [[artificial intelligence]], law, and [[smart contracts]].

title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: [[Liquid Law]] is a [[Domain Specific Legal Language]], that enables the easy and flexible creation of the [[Terms of Reference]] of a legally defined entity to participate in the political process.

title: Legal Changes
synopsis: Here we list [[Recent Changes]] to [[Legal Sites]]:

title: Fedwiki Tools
synopsis: Here we list a few tools that are of particular use in managing and creating [[Fedwiki]] content. For a full list of transporters navigate to the site below:

title: Changes to this Site
synopsis: Below we list recent changes to this site only without also listing changes from the [[Neighbourhood]]:

title: Unlimited company
synopsis: An unlimited company or private unlimited company is a hybrid company (corporation) incorporated with or without a share capital but where the legal liability of the members or shareholders is not limited: that is, its members or shareholders have a joint, several and non-limited obligation to meet any insufficiency in the assets of the company to enable settlement of any outstanding financial liability in the event of the company's formal liquidation. - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unlimited_company wikipedia]

title: Governance Unlimited
synopsis: Governance Unlimited is a project (an [[unlimited company]]) to research and develop new and innovative forms of [[governance]].

title: Governance
synopsis: Here we explore governance in the particular context of governing a commons, that is an organic federation or ecosystem of decentralised entities.

title: Legal sites
synopsis: Here we list a number of sites and resources about law. This page helps us track [[Legal Changes]]:

title: Citizens United
synopsis: Citizens United v. Federal Election Commission 558 U.S. 310 (2010) is a landmark U.S. constitutional law, campaign finance, and corporate law case dealing with regulation of political campaign spending by organizations - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Citizens_United_v._FEC wikipedia]

title: Free-culture movement
synopsis: The [[Free Culture]] movement is a social movement that promotes the freedom to distribute and modify creative works in the form of free content or open content by using the Internet and other forms of media - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free-culture_movement wikipedia]

title: Free Culture
synopsis: The [[free-culture movement]] is a social movement that promotes the freedom to distribute and modify creative works in the form of free content or open content by using the Internet and other forms of media - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free-culture_movement wikipedia]

title: Future Law
synopsis: Future law is law - but not as you know it Jim. It is a pragmatic system, or [[Legal Hack]] that we are able to compose partly out of code, and partly out of real-world legal elements.

title: Lexon
synopsis: Lexon is a contract programming language for lawyers.

title: Polycentric law
synopsis: __Polycentric law__ is a legal structure in which providers of [[legal system]]s compete or overlap in a given [[jurisdiction]], as opposed to [[monopoly]] [[statutory law]] according to which there is a sole provider of [[law]] for each jurisdiction. [[Devolution]] of this monopoly occurs by the principle of jurisprudence in which they [[rule according to higher law]] - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polycentric_law wikipedia]

title: Ulex
synopsis: Ulex is an open-source, digital law solution currently being developed by an open network of programmers and legal experts, borrowing from common law traditions unbound to a specific country - [https://www.reddit.com/r/Polycentric_Law/comments/9atro6/what_is_an_opensource_legal_system_join_the_ulex/ reddit]

title: Henning Diedrich
synopsis: A page with 1 items.
